headline: Here are the candidates running in Arizona's new 8th Congressional District
author: Melissa Estrada
sentences:
Here are the candidates running in Arizona's new 5th Congressional District
Under improving health care, Lesko's campaign website says she will fight to prioritize patient-doctor relationships, along with increasing competition and quality and lowering health care costs.

Here are the major candidates for the U.S. House of Representatives in Arizona's new 8th Congressional District:
Republicans:
Debbie Lesko
Debbie Lesko became the 8th Congressional District's representative in 2018.

Lesko's re-election campaign website speaks of the work she has left in office: "there is so much more to do especially in the area of improving healthcare, border security and fighting the coronavirus pandemic."
Arizona's new 8th Congressional District covers parts of Maricopa and Yavapai counties, including Glendale, Peoria, Sun City West and New River.
On immigration, she supports merit-based immigration, physical barriers and technology, and funding for more border personnel and training.
Incumbent Rep. Debbie Lesko, R-Ariz., is looking to keep her seat as the area's member of Congress.
Before that, she served in the Arizona House of Representatives from 2009 to 2015.
Lesko served in the Arizona State Senate from 2015 to 2018.
